CatDescriptText: Andrew Jackson, 2071 Bentley Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the recreational facilities for young people in Pittsburgh are adequate? If not, what do you think should be done about it?" answer reads: "I don't think so.  I say this program is so important that even if the money has to come out of the taxpayer's pocket, the program should begin.  However, I think that there is enough money coming in to enable such a program to be started."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Andrew Jackson wearing light colored ribbed coat with single button fastened, fedora, and plaid shirt, standing on sidewalk in front of Jay Drug Co.
